clinical_study.brief_title: Linezolid Pharmacokinetics (PK) in Multi-Drug Resistant (MDR)/Extensively-Drug Resistant (XDR) Tuberculosis (TB)
clinical_study.official_title: Linezolid Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics in the Treatment of Multi-Drug Resistant and Extensively-Drug Resistant Tuberculosis

lead_sponsor.agency: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

clinical_study.source: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

brief_summary.textblock: This is a one-period, double-blind, single-center pharmacokinetic study of linezolid in patients with MDR or XDR tuberculosis treated with linezolid and an Optimized Background Therapy (defined as treatment with > 4 drugs with activity against tuberculosis to which the patient's isolate is believed to be sensitive by history or based on drug sensitivity testing).

detailed_description.textblock: This is a one-period, double-blind, single-center pharmacokinetic study of linezolid in patients with MDR or XDR tuberculosis treated with linezolid and an Optimized Background Therapy (defined as treatment with > 4 drugs with activity against tuberculosis to which the patient's isolate is believed to be sensitive by history or based on drug sensitivity testing).

primary_outcome.measure: Characterize linezolid pharmacokinetic parameters (AUC0-24 and linezolid time over MIC) in patients with MDR-TB and XDR-TB.
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month after the start of study therapy

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess the pharmacodynamic effects of linezolid AUC0-24 on tolerability (bone marrow toxicity, peripheral and ocular neuropathies) and safety during four months of treatment of tuberculosis
characterize the pharmacokinetics of ofloxacin and potentially other second line anti-tuberculous drugs utilized in the treatment of patients with MDR TB.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: one month after starting study therapy

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess the pharmacodynamic effect of linezolid pharmacokinetic parameters ( on biomarkers of treatment activity. Biomarkers to be evaluated are time to detection in liquid culture, sputum culture conversion at two and four months of study treatment.

arm_group.description: Linezolid 600 mg po daily for 16 weeks (112 doses) given in addition to optimized background therapy for MDR TB
Over-encapsulated microcrystalline methylcellulose (Avicel) - an inert filler

intervention.description: Linezolid 600 mg po daily for 16 weeks (112 doses) - over-encapsulated
The placebo will be over-encapsulated microcrystalline methylcellulose

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Enrolled in the TBTC Study 30
- Provision of informed consent for the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe anemia as defined by a hematocrit less than 25% (most recent value, measured within 30 days of the PK study).
